title: [Large-scale] Ontology-Based Learning Design Model Development Course

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of Basic Learning Design Theory and Intermediate-Level Domain Expertise
context.additional_context: Strengthening capacity to develop socially contextualized learning content for professionals (medical/legal/technical)

learning_goals: They can explain learning model design procedures using ontology structures with 80%+ accuracy
Pass three practical evaluations demonstrating learning resource retrieval and reorganization skills in simulation/VR environments

Learners will develop a template-based automated learning content generation tool prototype reflecting community issues (e.g., environmental pollution, aging populations) and cultural diversity (e.g., multicultural family education) within two weeks and obtain evaluation results meeting functionality (template application accuracy ≥80%) and usability (user feedback survey ≥4/5) criteria from at least two out of three peer reviewers
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
